<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs=""
>
[Corpse Tender Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=3883) <actions string="" />
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Blood Lords</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Pathfinder #181: Zombie Feast](/Sources.aspx?ID=139) pg. 81

**Archetype** [Corpse Tender](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=196)

**Prerequisites**
Trained in [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13); evil alignment

</column>

---

You have a connection to [mindless](/Traits.aspx?ID=108) [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160) that allows you to communicate your intentions to them on a rudimentary level. You can use [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) to [Make an Impression](/Actions.aspx?ID=50) on mindless undead and to make very simple [Requests](/Actions.aspx?ID=51) of them; their mindless trait doesn't grant immunity to these [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106) effects. Most mindless undead are likely [hostile](/Conditions.aspx?ID=23) toward you by default and must be kept at a safe distance to give you time to Make an Impression.

 You become trained in Diplomacy; if already trained, you instead become trained in another skill of your choice.

**Special** You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the corpse tender archetype.

<title level="2">Corpse Tender Dedication leads to...</title>
[Command Corpse](/Feats.aspx?ID=3884), [Corpse Tender's Font](/Feats.aspx?ID=3885)
name: Corpse Tender Dedication
